Childhood favorite to some, a crazed party game to another; Castle Crashers is just great. A wacky adventure with 1-4 players that will grip you with it's amazing soundtrack featuring epic orchestras, creepy cave music and classic moodlifters. The story although standard is hugely helped by the comedic twists to the characters, areas and enemies. A fun system for weapons and pets along with satisfying hack and slash combat. The only negative i can think about in this game would be playing solo as it is faaar more fun with friends and the sometimes frustrating vertical element to the 2D side-scrolling. The game doesn't end after one completion either, each time you finish the game with a certain character you unlock another based on who you completed the game with. This allows for fun exploration of different abilites between the different characters. After completing the game you also unlock the hard mode which is just a more difficult mode for the game during your 2nd playthrough and onwards. The cherry on top in this game has to be the free-for-all pvp with all your teammates once you rescue a princess. Everyone is going tryhard to get that sweet sweet sugar.

Game is exceptionally good although rather short. Soundtrack alone is worth buying the game.
Combat is very fun and there are many cool bossfights. Play as knights with elemental powers and beat up every single person that stands in your way (including your friends when needed).

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

I am a 51 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 30 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he friended and invited me to join him. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.
The nostalgia in this game is crazy.

A great game and arguably one of the best couch co-op games out there. Nice visuals, lots of content and will run even on a potato PC. Many different types of mobs to fight, dozens of characters and swords for you to unlock. A campaign which is neither short nor easy. There's an insane mode, after you finish the game on normal. It's a game designed for multiplayer and it's genuinely fun to play with friends. Background music and sound effects are unique and slightly silly. 

You CAN play single player mode, if you want to unlock certain characters or want to test your own mettle. But that doesn't have the punch which multiplayer does. I wouldn't suggest buying this, if you don't have someone to play this game with. Because sadly, "play with anyone" multiplayer mode is almost deserted and folks play this game, usually play in closed lobbies with their friends. There is the option of joining a game group and find friendly people to play with. But that's not a as simple.

[b]Personal Rating:[/b]9/10

Castle crashers is a 2D RPG game in an animated style where your only goal will be to make a mess of everyone and it also has magic with which you can really electrify someone. It has three modes: Arena Mode - a typical arena where you fight enemies.
Back off Barbarians - you have to jump and dodge your enemies
story Mode-singleplayer or multiplayer (you can play all named modes in multiplayer)
story mod something like arena mode but with more locations.

Story: Not much, but at least someone has 5/10

Gameplay: Here I have to point out that it has terrible controls at the beginning, but you can adjust it 4/10

Style: The animated 2D style is my dream, so I have to give it 10/10

Soundtrack: The songs usually fit the moment 9/10

Length: It took me about 15 hours to finish, but it's definitely faster 10/10

Mods: Three are enough, all of them will keep you busy for a long time 10/10

Characters: I think more than 30 characters is enough and each one has different abilities 10/10

Final rating: 8.2/10

YO YO YO, WHAT'S UP PEOPLE? IT'S YA BOY HERE WITH A REVIEW ON CASTLE CRASHERS! NOW THIS GAME IS A TOTAL BLAST FROM THE PAST. I MEAN, I USED TO PLAY THIS GAME WHEN I WAS A LITTLE KID AND LET ME TELL YOU, IT WAS A GOOD TIME.

THE GRAPHICS ARE PRETTY SIMPLE BUT THAT'S OKAY BECAUSE IT ADDS TO THE NOSTALGIA FACTOR. I LOVE HOW YOU CAN PLAY WITH YOUR HOMIES AND JUST MESS AROUND. HOWEVER, I HAVE TO ADMIT, AS AN ADULT NOW, IT'S NOT AS FUN AS IT WAS BACK THEN.

DON'T GET ME WRONG, IT'S STILL A GOOD GAME, BUT IT'S JUST NOT AS ADDICTIVE AS IT USED TO BE. I FEEL LIKE IT'S MORE FOR THE KIDDOS THAN FOR GROWN-UPS. BUT HEY, IF YOU WANT TO RELIVE YOUR CHILDHOOD MEMORIES, THEN THIS IS THE GAME FOR YOU.

JUST DON'T EXPECT TOO MUCH FROM IT, YA HEAR? IT'S JUST A SIMPLE AND FUN GAME TO PLAY WITH YOUR BUDDIES. SO, IF YOU'RE LOOKING FOR A QUICK AND EASY GAME TO PLAY, THEN CASTLE CRASHERS IS WORTH THE MONEY.

BUT TO BE HONEST, I WOULDN'T PAY FULL PRICE FOR IT. IT'S KIND OF A RIP-OFF IF YOU ASK ME. BUT IF IT'S ON SALE, THEN GO AHEAD AND SNAG IT UP.

PEACE OUT!
-Fe Asper

Title: Hilarious, Action-Packed Co-op Beat 'em Up!


Review:
Castle Crashers is a side-scrolling beat 'em up game that blends humor, action, and addictive gameplay into a memorable co-op experience. Developed by The Behemoth, Castle Crashers offers a charming hand-drawn art style, engaging combat system, and a variety of playable characters, making it a must-play for fans of the genre.

Gameplay: 9/10
Castle Crashers' gameplay is easy to pick up but offers depth for those looking to master its combat mechanics. The game features a wide range of playable characters, each with unique abilities and stat progression. The combat is fast-paced, with various weapon types and elemental magic adding variety to the gameplay. Players can also collect various pets that provide unique bonuses during battles. The game truly shines in co-op mode, with up to four players battling through hordes of enemies and challenging boss fights together.

Graphics: 9/10
The hand-drawn art style of Castle Crashers is colorful, quirky, and filled with personality. The game's animations are smooth and expressive, with a great attention to detail. Each level offers a unique setting, filled with humor and visual gags that keep the game feeling fresh and engaging.

Sound: 8/10
Castle Crashers' sound design complements its art style and gameplay perfectly, with catchy tunes and satisfying sound effects. The game's soundtrack features a mix of upbeat, energetic tracks and more atmospheric pieces that enhance the overall experience.

Performance: 9/10
Castle Crashers runs smoothly on a wide range of hardware configurations, ensuring that the game is accessible to players with various system requirements. The game's controls are responsive and customizable, allowing for an enjoyable and hassle-free experience.

Community: 8/10
The Castle Crashers community is generally friendly and welcoming, with players often sharing tips, strategies, and fan art. Although the game has been out for a while, it still maintains a dedicated player base that continues to enjoy its co-op gameplay and humor.

Overall: 8.5/10
Castle Crashers is an entertaining and addictive beat 'em up that offers a charming art style, engaging combat system, and hilarious humor. Its co-op gameplay is a blast to play with friends, providing countless hours of fun as you battle your way through its quirky world. Whether you're a fan of the genre or just looking for a lighthearted game to play with friends, Castle Crashers delivers an unforgettable experience that keeps you coming back for more.

The classic arcade feel when it came to fighting games was furious mashing. So I guess they weren't wrong when it came to Castle Crashers.

Aside from the gum-grinding mechanics of general play, button mashing is the main gist of this game. Don't try to play tactical, no sir. That's the BEST way to get ganged up on and out...maneuvered? If you wanna call a counter-gameplay mechanic a maneuver. Everything about this game is a fight, especially with the game itself. You are fighting EVERYTHING. EVERYTHING WANTS YOU TO HAVE A BAD DAY.

So unless you have friends to play this with, don't even bother. And even then, I'm sure you all would be better off with Mario Kart or Mario Party.

I am a 51 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 30 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he friended and invited me to join him. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

Castle Crashers is one of the best games because of its fun, engaging gameplay, colorful and vibrant art style, and its ability to be enjoyed by both casual and hardcore gamers. The game is a side-scrolling beat 'em up game that allows up to four players to play cooperatively. Players can choose from a variety of characters, each with their own unique abilities and upgrade paths. The game's humor and storyline are also big draws, with memorable boss battles and hilarious cutscenes that keep players invested in the game. Additionally, Castle Crashers has a high replay value, with players being able to play through the game multiple times and unlock new characters and items. Overall, Castle Crashers is a game that has something for everyone and is sure to provide hours of fun and entertainment.

[h1]Castle Crashers: An Epic Battle of [/h1]

If you're looking for a game that will test your combat skills and provide hours of entertainment, then look no further than Castle Crashers. As a Decepticon warrior, I am always on the lookout for a challenge, and this game certainly delivers.

[b]Gameplay[/b]
Castle Crashers is a side-scrolling beat 'em up game that will keep you on your toes. You'll face off against a variety of enemies and bosses, each with their unique fighting style. The game provides a range of weapons and magic spells that can be used to your advantage, just like in our battles on Cybertron.

[u]Humor[/u]
Despite the serious nature of our battles, Castle Crashers adds a lighthearted tone with its humor. The game is full of hilarious jokes and references that will keep you laughing while you're bashing in some Autobot heads. The game's cartoonish graphics and quirky characters add to the overall experience, making it a fun and enjoyable game.

[b]Co-op[/b]
Playing Castle Crashers with fellow Decepticons is always a good time. The game is designed to be played co-op, and it's much more enjoyable when you have someone to play with. You can work together to take down bosses, revive each other when needed, and share items and weapons.

[i]Tip[/i]: Don't be afraid to experiment with different weapons and magic spells. Each Decepticon has their unique abilities, so try them all out to find what works best for you and your partner.

[hr][/hr]

Overall, Castle Crashers is a great game for Decepticon warriors looking for an epic battle on Earth. The game's humor, co-op gameplay, and challenging combat make it a must-play for any fan of the Transformers franchise. So gather your fellow Decepticons, grab your weapons, and let the battle begin!

Castle Crashers is eternal, memorable and inevitable. It has always existed and it will always exist as it was designed to be timeless, designed to be indefinitely replayed, designed for co-op and designed for fun. 

People have played this on and off since 2012 and they will continue to do so until the end of recorded history. This game drags you back in for 5+ hours every couples years to relive the sensation of undertaking an epic journey and unlocking new characters to epic journey with. 

The weapons, the magic pets, the playable characters and the ‚Äúwtf am I looking at‚Äù moments never stop. . 

The combat is clean, the movement is fluid, the boss fights are epic and the story is told silently in such a comedic way it almost feels sombering when contrasted with the death you cause. 

You unlock enemies by fighting them in coliseums or beating the linear campaign. You keep on playing to keep on unlocking characters. You then use these characters to beat the story again and unlock more characters. It‚Äôs like trickle down economics but not stupid. 

87/100

Castle Crashers is a 2D side-scrolling action game developed and published by The Behemoth. The game was first released in 2008, but it remains a popular game due to its humor, colorful visuals, and engaging gameplay.

The game's story is relatively simple: a group of knights must save the kingdom's princesses from an evil sorcerer. However, the game's humorous writing and over-the-top cartoon violence make it a joy to play. The game's art style is bright and colorful, with each character having a distinct look and personality.

Gameplay in Castle Crashers is straightforward, with players battling enemies and bosses across a variety of levels. The game's combat system is simple to learn, with players able to attack, block, and use special moves. Players can also unlock new weapons and characters as they progress through the game.

Castle Crashers also features local and online multiplayer, which allows up to four players to play together. Multiplayer adds a new dimension to the game, as players can work together to defeat enemies and bosses.

The game's music and sound effects are also noteworthy, with catchy tunes and satisfying sound effects that enhance the game's action.

One potential downside of Castle Crashers is its length. The game can be completed in a few hours, and while the game is designed for replayability, some players may find the game's content to be lacking.

Overall, Castle Crashers is a fun and engaging game that is perfect for players who enjoy humor, cartoon violence, and action games. Its colorful visuals, simple gameplay mechanics, and multiplayer options make it a great game for playing with friends.

If you're looking for a game that will make you feel like a heroic knight, while also making you laugh so hard you'll spit out your mead, then Castle Crashers is the game for you.

This side-scrolling adventure game is chock-full of wacky characters, hilarious dialogue, and over-the-top battles. You and up to three friends can team up and embark on a quest to rescue princesses, defeat evil wizards, and battle bizarre bosses, all while unleashing a barrage of attacks and magic spells.

The humor in Castle Crashers is on point, with witty one-liners, sight gags, and absurd situations that will have you rolling on the floor. And let's not forget about the animal companions that you can unlock and ride into battle, including a giant frog, a snail, and a deer with laser eyes.

But don't let the humor fool you - Castle Crashers is also a challenging game, with plenty of tough enemies and boss battles that will put your skills to the test. You'll need to strategize, dodge attacks, and use all of your abilities if you want to emerge victorious.

Overall, Castle Crashers is an excellent game that strikes the perfect balance between humor and action. If you're a fan of medieval knights, silly humor, or just want to have a blast with your friends, then you need to add this game to your collection. And if you're not careful, you might just become addicted to the laughter and adventure that Castle Crashers has to offer.

You can play through the main story, do arenas, and then there's "insane mode" which is similar to new game+ in a way, enemies get massively tougher and you play through again. You can do this on every character (which there's a lot of) that adds a lot of replayability.

+ Love the art style
+ Great soundtrack and audio
+ Good funnies
+ Good variety of characters
+ Fun in co-op (options of online & local)
+ Playable with mouse & keyboard aswell as controller
+ Lots of weapons & pets to collect

For the price this game is a steal, get it!
The story brought me to the ends of human emotion.

If you want to know if Castle Crashers worths playing, the answer is yes. It's a fantastic indie game that has to be in your Steam library.

The story is simple: an evil wizard creates chaos in a kingdom by stealing a huge crystal and kidnapping the four princesses. You play (when you are new) as one of the four knights. Each one has an unique magical hability: red has the lighting power, blue the ice power, orange the fire power and green the poison power. Then your mission is to progress all along the map defeating enemies and upgrading your character until the final boss.

Gameplay is really creative and unique: basically the game is a beat-em-up with weapons and magic. There is also a pet that might help you (there are 28 pets, and 29 if you buy Battleblock Theater). As I mentioned, each character has an unique hability that might help you on your journey. You can buy consumibles that will help you unlock new pets, weapons and areas. Apart from the story, you have an arena mode and a crappy minigame of surviving on a board. As consumibles you have bombs that help you destroy obstacles, a bow, health potions and a sandwich (TF2 reference??). The weapon's arsenal is huge, with weapons that can improve your stadistics. The Behemoth was really creative with this game. 

Graphically looks really good, like an old Flash game (basically the game was on Newgrounds), with a cartoonish style.

Soundtrack is well-made too, with a really envolving music. 

But what's the best of the game? Multiplayer. That's right, it has coop mode for all the game modes, and honestly it feels much amusing playing with three more friends rather than alone, no matter if it's story, arena or the minigame. 

If you want to get archievements and badges, this game is ideal for you. Archievements are, most of them, easy to get just by playing solo or with friends (some of them need a partner to be archieved). 

I think at full price game is not a bad deal. You pay 12‚Ç¨ for a game that you can spend hours and hours playing alone or with friends, with two DLCs that cost less than 1‚Ç¨ (still, I don't like the blacksmith). So if you buy it for full price, you won't regret it.

Fixing some old reviews of mine, seeing as a lack of any sort of analysis was used (I was too young to be able to do so and relied on jokes to get a point across.) and, unlike some of my review edits I have (and will) make, this one... This one stings. Now, my first experience with Castle Crashers was back on the Xbox 360 and it's in no means a bad game. But there have been so many times I've taken hits when they didn't even visually connect for that attack and my attacks seem to do nothing when I'm clearly positioned right to hit them. The more recent versions of the game's changes also soured the experience a lot for me. The new modes and menus are jarring to me as I was used to how they used to look. A lot of progression is confusingly worded and I had to look up way too much. I also can't find any way to reset a character if I wanted to start again. I wish this game had the same shine to me it did when I first played it. But the light somehow walked into itself.

Castle Crashers is a really fun game. The levels and characters are designed really well. The music is amazing, the art style is really charming.  There are many unlockable characters, pets, and weapons to unlock. The game is really fun the first few playthroughs, but after that, it just gets repetitive. I'd say it's a 6/7.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

Though it can be played single player, I would [i]highly recommend[/i] playing it with friends if possible. Game is worth the price but it doesn't hurt to wait for a sale. If you find the regular game mode to be too easy, you can replay it in a harder mode to really test your skill.

Arcade-ey hack and slash game from some of the old legendary creators of Newgrounds. Their company, The Behemoth, was formed specifically to take you back to the past with a modern twist. 

Castle Crashers is a silly romp through colorful and beautiful, hand-drawn lands to collect all kinds of nifty little powerups while you become the strongest knight in the land and kiss all the princesses (unless your friends do first).

It's a tongue-in-cheek fusion of the best old beat-em-ups your dad wasted his quarters on. Double Dragon, Golden Axe, Turtles in Time, and many more all influence this game's play style. Each knight has its own variation of spells to learn and can be further customized through pets and weapons you find in-game which will be added to your armory. 

Memorable boss fights, locations, and experiences with your friends. It's all here.

castle crashers is a action rpg/beat em up hybrid developed by the behemoth, the second game they ever released, however the steam version had the 2015 remastered version added on to the original with a free update. it's a side-scrolling beat em up with some pretty basic rpg elements tied to what character you use. there's a super mario world-like overworld you go through as you complete the game, and with 4-player co-op supported, this is an absolute blast to play online with friends. your progression is tied to your character, so a group of people playing can only go as far as whoever is the farthest in the story. it's a very simple concept but not something you always get with co-op games. the game isn't terribly long, as for most people a single playthrough will be coming in around 6-8 hours depending on a few factors. but for me the fun was playing other characters and grabbing all the achievements, while also playing the minigames that were added in the remastered version. the game is fun for a single playthrough, but playing again with other characters or weapons. I definitely rushed through this, as there was a lot more to do but after getting all the achievements, i didn't feel the need to try to get every character to lvl 99 or anything like that. overall, grabbing this game for $3 (or 80% off) is a steal and this is one of those games that are probably worth grabbing a four pack, as most people who have 3 people to gift the game to probably wouldn't regret it if they could all play together.

Castle Crashers is a blast from the past ‚Äì a game that takes me back to the good ol' days of gaming when things were simpler and more fun. With its retro graphics and simple, yet satisfying gameplay, it's a reminder of why we fell in love with gaming in the first place.

In a world where games are constantly pushing the envelope with cutting-edge graphics and complex mechanics, it's refreshing to play a game like Castle Crashers that hearkens back to a simpler time. The good ol' days of gaming were all about having fun, and that's exactly what Castle Crashers delivers.

As I hack and slash my way through castles and dungeons, I can't help but feel a sense of nostalgia for the good ol' days of gaming. It's a feeling that I don't get from many modern games, and it's one that I cherish.

Overall, if you're looking for a fun and nostalgiciac gaming experience, look no further than Castle Crashers. It's a reminder of why we fell in love with gaming in the first place, and it's a perfect escape from the complex and sometimes overwhelming world of modern gaming.
